citeinfo.origin: MNDNR - Ecological Services and Fisheries Divisions
citeinfo.title: Lake Bathymetric Contours

pubinfo.publish: MNDNR - Ecological Services and Fisheries Divisions

descript.abstract: Contours lines corresponding to lake bathymetry, digitized from existing lake contour maps produced by the DNR Ecological Services Lake Mapping Unit.
descript.purpose: Limnological studies, experimental design, field studies, morphometric analyses.
descript.supplinf: Statewide, however GIS products have only been completed for selected lakes at this time.

sngdate.caldate: Various dates. See Contact Information to obtain

timeperd.current: Product dates depend on field work dates related to production of original lake contour maps. Zero depth values correspond to lake shoreline and islands as digitized from 1991-92 aerial photography (1m DOQ's). See Contact Information to obtain dates for individual products.

theme.themekey: hydrography, lakes, bathymetry, contours, depth, inlandWaters

idinfo.useconst: Internal DNR use is unrestricted. External use is constrained by the standard, general DNR GIS Data License Agreement

attracc.attraccr: Source table BATH_CONTLN3.DBF: Depth values for individual lakes are based on field work performed during production of original lake contour maps. Over the years, field work has been performed on different lakes using a variety of techniques with varying accuracies. Lakes with more recent determinations are generally considered to be more accurate due to better technology and shorter periods of change to present. Contour data has been conformed to fit lake outlines digitized from the most recent aerial photographs (1m DOQ's 1991-92).

dataqual.logic: Individual contour lines are linear features that form continuous loops without undershoots or overshoots; they appear as polygons but are linear features and thus have no area or perimeter attributes.
dataqual.complete: GIS products have been completed for a group of selected lakes. Work is proceeding on a lake-by-lake basis following priorities set by DNR Fisheries (funding source for this project).

horizpa.horizpar: Source layer bath_contln3: Not specifically assessed

vertacc.vertaccr: Source layer bath_contln3: Not specifically assessed

procstep.procdesc: Attribute Lineage for source table BATH_CONTLN3.DBF: Bathymetric contours were assigned depth values as specified on existing lake contour maps. In some cases, additional depth contours were added as estimated from the lake bathymetric DEM (bath_dem03ra3) to match the shaded relief bathymetric DEM image (bath_shdrim3.tif)

distbrep.distres: Source layer bath_contln3: Not specifically assessed

overview.eaover:
Data Elements for Attribute Table BATH_CONTLN3.DBF:
DEPTH: Depth
overview.eadetcit: Value Domain for Data Element DEPTH: 0 = Lake shoreline or island contour -1 to - 200 = Depth (in negative feet), usually a multiple of -5
